Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC 707”
Reviews.Author: taylor l
Reviews.Content: After spending time at the Mahana, I can't talk enough about the beauty of the people at the Mahana, the management, housekeeping, everyone who made my stay beyond perfect. And the view...there simply is no better view on any of the sandwich islands, none. Mahalo to all who made my trip the best vacation I've had.

Reviews.Title: “Family Review”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, our son/daughter in law and grandson stayed at The Mahana for one week January 18-25, 2012 in Condo 211 and were ecstastic! Our accomodations exceeded our expectations! Our grandson had a fabulous time exploring the lanai each morning, watching the whales in front of him and the swimmers to the right of him!! Service was extraordinary and every effort was made to make us feel at home and comfortable!! Kudos to the Mahana staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Mahana 301 (2BR/2BATH) WITH PICTURES”
Reviews.Author: SnorkelKitty
Reviews.Content: For photos of Mahana 301: http://www.flickr.com/photos/66092810@N02/sets/72157627895323658/ The Mahana is a condo property in the Ka'anapali (western Maui) area. Each unit is ocean front and has full floor to ceiling windows. There appeared to be mostly adults staying here. We felt very safe here, even walking through the grounds at night. The Mahana grounds are quiet, well maintained, clean and there is ample free parking space. They are re-doing the entry doors to each unit which will include windows to let more light in to the studio and one bedroom units (the two bedrooms are already bright). There is a grocery store right across the street. This particular unit is privately owned and offered for rent on two by-owner rental sites. We were three adults who stayed here for two wonderful weeks in September 2011. Jennifer, the owner, was very good to work with and alleviated my fears of renting via VRBO (especially because we booked nearly a year in advance). She always answered emails and addressed any problems or questions quickly and pleasantly. The condo was clean, well organized and had everything we could have asked for and more. I am very particular about cleanliness and this condo was VERY clean compared to some five star hotels we have visited. The kitchen was fully stocked with every utensil and cooking item we could have needed (not that I cooked on vacation). The quality of the finishes were top notch. The counter area has two chairs for a quick morning breakfast. The dining table between the counter seating area and living room has four chairs, so six can sit and eat comfortably. The rear bedroom (island view) was quiet and comfortable. It has a large walk-in shower and dressing area with sink and storage for personal items. Storage under the bench in the rear bedroom held extra sheets and blankets. The master bedroom held a comfy, CLEAN king sized bed and still left plenty of room for two large Asian inspired bedside tables. The built-ins had more than enough room for our clothes and personal items. The stacked washer/dryer unit is in the master bedroom behind full sized mirror doors. It doesn’t hold much at once, but that is common for a stacked unit. The large walk-in shower is built for two. The separate shower and toilet area also has a cabinet for storage. Floor to ceiling windows provide breath taking views. The side window between the kitchen and dining area provides a full view of the pool area - from the grill area and main entry (on the left) to the ocean (on the right). The walls are a dark green but there is no lack of light in this condo. Well placed track/recessed lighting and natural light from the floor to ceiling windows give this condo a bright airy feel. On a side note . . . We did view a few other units (that were for sale) while we were there. The 301 unit was very clean, bright and updated in comparison to some others. The studio units seemed adequate for two people if you are only staying for a few days. To me it seems that after a few days I would feel cramped. The one bedroom units would be perfect for two people, but didn’t have the views that the two bedroom units have. The separate bedroom made for a more home-like environment and afforded more closet room. Be sure to ask to see pictures of the bathrooms, some had shower/tub units that were not updated as nicely as unit 301. The only thing I would change about the Mahana would be to make the condo and grounds non-smoking (the actual unit was non-smoking). We would not hesitate to stay at the Mahana 301 again. Thank you to Jennifer for being a joy to rent from!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Mahana unit 1104”
Reviews.Author: kittyboo2011
Reviews.Content: After 3 month of research in TA, I decided Mahana unit #1104. I booked through Chase ‘n Rainbows which customer service was very efficient and everything was done in 20 min. An advantage to book directly through owners is you get a room exactly what you want, and a disadvantage is when you arrive, even if you don’t like the room with some reasons, you are stuck with it. I liked the fact that the owners had 3 other units in Mahana and if emergency, I could contact Chase ‘n Rainbows which had a local office in Maui. The unit 1104 was exactly what shown in the pictures. It was very clean, high quality, tasty decoration and very comfortable. I am picky about a bed. The still new king size bed was not too hard and not too soft, very comfy bed. The kitchen had all the basic stuff you need, not for a heavy duty cooking but who wants to do in vacation in hot weather. I recommend checking in the room first and see what the unit has in the kitchen such as salt, paper, coffee, sugar, BBQ spices,… then go to a store. There were 6 beach chairs, 2 of which were high quality ones and we borrowed them every day to beaches. There were also 2 cooler boxes. The refrigerator had an ice maker, so we didn’t’ need to buy ice. When we went to Hana, we took both cooler boxes packed with a salad, bread, lunch ham and drinks we bought from Times and we had a nice lunch at Hana Beach Park. Someone posted about the building repair construction recently, but I didn’t see any construction guys or didn’t hear any noise even in daytime. Also many people posted that Internet connection was not so good in rooms, but I was surprised we didn’t have any problem in our room. I think we had a modem in the room. The dual sinks in bathroom were large enough for two of us and were convenient to get ready in early morning. There was a plenty of bath towels and kitchen towels but not a hair dryer there. There were 2 elevators in each building, which were fast and never crowded. We used a pool and a hot tub, which were never crowded either. Tip: You can rent a beach towel through Chase ‘n Rainbows $2/each. It is an oversized blue color and quality is good. We rented 4 and didn’t need to pack our own in our luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice. Best place I've ever stayed on Maui!”
Reviews.Author: Alan32655
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a bunch of places in Maui, and this is definitely the nicest place so far. For starts, this is the only one I've seen where the living room and bedroom both have a view of the water; normally the bedroom is tucked in the back, with poor ventilation and no view. The entire west side of the living room and most of the bedroom was floor-to-ceiling windows. The deck/patio was entirely private, with no views of other decks (or views into ours). Kitchen was very nicely stocked. Beds were comfortable, if soft. Great A/C for when it got muggy. The pool was quite pretty and big enough for general family waterplay, although perhaps not suitable for swimming laps; we saw quite a few people swimming off the beach. Beyond these things, there was a grocery store and a couple casual restaurants across the street, and Lahaina is only about 5 miles south, making the location much more convenient than Napili, for example. Great snorkeling is just a few miles north at Honolua Bay. We booked through Pleasant Hawaiian and were assigned a room by the front desk. In all of our dealings they seemed very genuinely focused on providing the best service possible. In short, I found this a great place and wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge services!”
Reviews.Author: Andpandi
Reviews.Content: Susan was the concierge that assisted me when I arrived. She was very helpful and friendly, yet after she got my booking was apparently to busy to acknowledge me. I said hello to her in passing a few days later, and she acted as though she didn't know me. She was interested in me when getting my commissions. On the other hand, PJ was fabulous!!!!! He is the weekend concierge, he is friendly, helpful, kind, and always acts as though you are important. If you need concierge, try to wait till the weekend when PJ is working, you won't be sorry :)

Reviews.Title: “Dream fulfilled; couldn't have asked for anything better!”
Reviews.Author: DanSarahHall
Reviews.Content: We were there last week in Unit 105. Rental though Chas'n Rainbows. Top of the line condo with walk out access via the lanai to chaise lounges and the beach. Floor to ceiling windows and mirrors so that every room and every angle has a beach view. Perfect place to stay for a quiet, romantic, relaxing get away but close enough to activities in Kaanapali and Lahania to make them easily available. Shops and supermarket within walking distance. Outstanding beachfront with several shades of Pacific Ocean blue hues and nice waves that crash on the caramel colored sand. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana Resort Unit 714”
Reviews.Author: rgneff
Reviews.Content: We were really happy with the Mahana and unit #714, which we rented through VRBO - would go back any time. Rent with confidence. Unit 714 is modern, clean, and comfortable with the fantastic views that only a few resorts right on the beach like the Mahana can give you. The condo owner, Joan, is very nice and let's her renters (a loyal bunch, based on the guest book entries) use the snorkel equipment, boards, and beach towels, which is a huge help. For those who need extra equipment, Snorkel Bob's is just across the street from the Mahana entrance. The resort is lovely, without being pretentious and overbearing like some others. Conveniently located, and with a great Dukeâ€™s restaurant right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found!”
Reviews.Author: MauiMama_11
Reviews.Content: We always return to the Mahana year after year. We rent through VRBO, and you can't beat the value you get for true ocean front accomodations! Sitting on your lanai you can whale watch, see dolphins & turtles! The beach is right at your finger tips, and nothing beats falling asleep to the sound of the waves. The pool/hot tub area is never crowded & there are tons of lounge chairs for your use either by the pool or by the beach. The kitchens are fully stocked & having in suite washer & dryer is always a bonus when travelling with children. There's ample free parking and a strip mall with grocery store and shops right across the street. A short drive takes you to Whaler's Village shopping & dining, and to the town of Lahaina. Dukes restaurant is right next door for a great dinner and live evening entertainment. There's a paved trail along the beach that is great for a morning jog or evening stroll, and goes all the way to Whaler's Village. There is nothing negative I can say about the Mahana, and I always look forward to returning every year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Mahana”
Reviews.Author: MahanaFan
Reviews.Content: We stay at the mahana every year. This is the perfect spot, right next door is dukes a wonderfull place to eat breakfast lunch and dinner. And the beach is right in front, 25 feet in front of you. Each year we make our reservation using gomahana.com or vrbo.com or homeaway.com to get the best deal from the owners direct. Make your reservations early as we had some trouble this year getting a place to stay at the Mahana!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful place...Paradise”
Reviews.Author: TravlinCC
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Maui with all of our family and the mteens, boyfriend/girlfriend Stayed at the Mahana in a condo unit rented through Chasn m Rainbows. What a abeautiful place. Our suite 2 bedroom was absolutely gorgeous, the view one I have never had the luxery to have before. Floor to glass windows, felt like we were standing on the ocean. Could see whales from our livingroom. Sunsetssand Sunrises great. The kitchen facilities were excewllent we had everything we needed and more. The red sandy beach was soft and warm and there were long sidewalks and paths so we could do a morning walk everyday. People here seem to get up early. may be a time change thing., However, there were no noise issues at all. THey have outdoor grills to use and a small be good pool and sitting area, most people seemed to beach it however. The shopping plaza for incidentals was directly across the street walking easyy.The village a shor car ride away. This is a must trty vacation destination. I litereally want to retire here now. Try codo rentals It is DEF the way to go. My daughter ghas lived in Oahu for the past six years and Maui beats the hustle and bustle of that island a thousand times over. I feel we have found our paradise!!!If you want more info on the owners of the property please feel free to email me and I will provide their info

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING, PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: CantonLady
Reviews.Content: Spent 8 days here in December, 2010. The condo complex is absolutely outstanding, I wish I could give it more than 5 stars. The staff is supurb, Karen at the front desk, Mark the manager and Susan the Expedia Guest Services representative. All went the extra mile to help us during our stay. The view is breathtaking and the grounds are very convenient to all activities on the island. The best new thing is the beach walk opened in 2010. You can go through the condo parking lot and walk 5 miles all the way to the Hyatt. Dukes a great restaurant is right next door. There are many beach facilities along the walkway if you want to stop and swim, walk, whatever. Great jog in the AM. There is no much to do on the island or you can do nothing. The units are updated yearly and my fav unit, 915, had many upgrades next year. I always rent from the condo itself, NOT VRBO, because of the personal assistance. The deposit is small and balance is not due until you check out. If you need anything, call the front desk and they are right there for you. Parking is free, there is a great grocery store across the street and a great pizza place in the same complex. You are about 15 minutes from Lahaina, a great place to shop on Front Street, restaurants, etc. If you go, you must try Kemo's and Ruth Chriss Steakhouse. They are wonderful. Had a great lunch at Cheeseburger in Paradise. This town reminds me a lot of St. Thomas in the Virgin Islands. Overall, you will not go wrong with this location. I am planning on making this a yearly condo rental and hope the pricing stays within range. THANK YOU MAHANA FOR A WONDERFUL VACATION.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana! Loved it”
Reviews.Author: theshig
Reviews.Content: Mahana was great, we stayed 8+ days. The location & view was great. Nice people, clean rooms, nice pool & spa.

Reviews.Title: “Mahana Resort Unit 611”
Reviews.Author: pdrvmr
Reviews.Content: Outstanding 2bd 2 bath condo. Unit has probably the largest lanai of all. The view is simply outstanding. This unit is a corner unit which gives you a panoramic view of the oceans and plam trees as well as overlooking the pool and hot tub. Everything is supplied for your use. Listen to the waves at night as youkick back after a great day at on Maui or just hanging out at the beach. The owners Rick & Patty Cassidy do not come any nicer or helpful. Although you are renting from them they actually go out of their way to make you feel that this unit is your home. Everyone needs a Patty in their family! Rent this condo, you will be happy you did .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, services, and value.”
Reviews.Author: DickS89
Reviews.Content: This is the second time that we have stayed at the Mahana and it has more than exceeded our expectations both times. The condominium unit(s) 219 and 319 offer outstanding views of the beach and the ocean and are very comfortable and relaxing. (One mild complaint [actually more of an issue than a complaint] is the inability of the Mahana to guarantee the specific unit requested.) The amenities (pool, beach, hot tub, barbecue facilities, towels) and the staff are all top notch contribute to a very relaxing and enjoyable environment. The location is perfect in that it is far enough away from the hustle and bustle of Lahaina to offer uncrowded beach areas etc. yet close enough to grocery shopping etc. to be convenient. With the Grace of God - we will return in two years or with the Grace of God and a winning lottery ticket - much more often. Mahalo for a gret time.

Reviews.Title: “The Mahana is a fabulous place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: DonSE
Reviews.Content: The entire staff is exceptional, and the views are absolutely wonderful. You don't need a whale watch trip with the entire event right outside your window. Each unit has floor to ceiling windows on the ocean front, in fact you are almost cantilevered out over the ocean. Kaanapali is a good location except for the Wimea area but 10 minutes from Laihaina and Kapalui. Lots of great restaurants in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: mauilouglo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had 15 glorious days at the Mahana in Maui.I've been to Maui a half dozen times and stayed in both Wailea and Kaanapali. As far as location, restaurants and most attractions you just can't beat the west side of Maui. Kaanapali has it all! We stayed in #708 at the Mahana which was lovely. It had everything you need to make yourselve at home. This is the place if you're looking more for peace and quiet. Those huge posh hotels just don't offer tranquility. I booked through vrbo online with ease and would highly recommend the Mahana and # 708.

HotelInfo.Name: The Mahana at Kaanapali resort
HotelInfo.Address: Kaanapali, Maui, Hawaii, Ka'anapali, Maui, HI
